category.motivation: The article discusses political strategy and election dynamics, which is a geopolitical event.

impact.motivation: The article provides commentary on Trump’s micro‑targeting strategy and Democratic messaging but does not introduce new factual data, so its impact on the node is minimal.

article_node.title: Bill Maher tells Dems how Trump became a ‘master’ at picking off their voters
article_node.summary: Bill Maher on "Real Time" accused Democrats of being outmaneuvered by Trump’s knack for targeting niche voter blocs—ranging from tipped service workers to TikTok users and crypto enthusiasts—arguing that this micro‑level focus helped Trump win Nevada in 2024. He contrasted Trump’s pragmatic, issue‑specific appeals with the Democrats’ emphasis on lofty ideals, suggesting the former’s sales‑style messaging resonates more with voters. Maher’s remarks highlighted Trump’s ability to “pick off” small groups and turn their concerns into electoral gains, while dismissing the Democratic platform as lacking the political skill to sell it.
